item.title: Change Npc Speach
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

You seriously must be doing something wrong. Don’t be embaressed to say you don’t know what a compiler is if that’s the problem, it’s the only way you’re question can be answerd.

You have to go into npchandler.java and search for what the NPC says, including inverted comma’s. (") Say the NPC says something like this

I sell newb stuff!

You would search

"I sell newb stuff!"

In npchandler.java and change it to whatever you wan’t. Remember you must keep the inverted comma’s there, if you don’t you’ll get errors. Once you’ve changed it, you need to save the file and compile.

Read full topic

item.title: Change Npc Speach
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

You need to compile. You can do this by double-clicking compiler.bat and typing ‘c’. If compiled successfuly, you should see this :

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Assuming you’re using Mod Taharok’s compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Change Npc Speach
item.dc:creator: @icauseownage icauseownage
item.description:
@icauseownage wrote:

go to npchandler search for the npcid in which you want to change the text OR ctrl F and search what the NPc already says and change it between the quotation marks “”. if you wanna make a new one for a new NPC, find one them and press enter after the last } and tab about 3 times if im correct and start typing but remember to change the id to the new npc you want to say something.

Read full topic

go into NPCHANDLER.java and ctrl+f and search for moo then you should be able to change the stuff from there
